[/p] [p] In 1935 Ackroyd was put in charge of Entwhistle Halt on the Darwen-Bolton line. There was nothing special about the halt: it had a signal cabin, about a dozen levers, and a pair of gates to allow carts to cross to the farms scattered across the moors.
